intro: Cyphokentia carolinensis, commonly known as the Carolina palm, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Arecaceae family, which includes palms, and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and feathery fronds. The plant typically grows in wetlands and along waterways, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and clustered, producing fruits that are edible for some bird species. The Carolina palm is often used in landscaping due to its ornamental value and ability to thrive in humid environments.
